alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 12:15AM CDT until June 18 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma... McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northern Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1214 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Preston to 4 miles northwest of Yeager, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Mcalester... Okmulgee... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Warner... Morris... Quinton... Dewar... Porum... Schulter... Crowder... Oktaha... Braggs... Boynton... Canadian... Indianola... Grayson... Council Hill... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 234 and 282. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg
